meanings.definition: The transfer of possession of personal property from one person to another under agreement.
meanings.sent1: I left my bike with my friend as a bailment while I went on vacation.
meanings.sent2: The bailment of the car keys to the valet ensured they would be safely parked.
meanings.sent3: The bailment of the umbrella to the cat resulted in a comical attempt at staying dry.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was like a bailment of her heart, hoping he would handle it with care.
meanings.sent5: The bailment of the secret to her best friend proved to be a wise decision.

meanings.definition: The act of delivering goods or property to another for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The bailment of the package to the courier was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent2: She made a bailment of the tools to her neighbor for the weekend project.
meanings.sent3: The bailment of the cookies to the jar was met with a mischievous grin.
meanings.sent4: His words were a bailment of hope to her, promising a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The bailment of the treasure map to the pirate led to a thrilling adventure.
